events.title: Queen Victoria Dies
events.description: Queen Victoria of the United Kingdom dies after a reign of 63 years, marking the end of the Victorian era.
events.significance: Her death marked the end of an era that shaped British culture, politics, and society profoundly.

events.title: Bloody Sunday in St. Petersburg
events.description: Russian troops massacre peaceful protesters in St. Petersburg, igniting the 1905 Russian Revolution.
events.significance: The event sparked nationwide protests and set the stage for future revolutionary movements in Russia.

events.title: Roe v. Wade Decision
events.description: The U.S. Supreme Court legalizes abortion nationwide in the landmark Roe v. Wade case.
events.significance: This ruling profoundly affected women's reproductive rights and sparked ongoing political and social debates.

events.title: The Paris Peace Accords
events.description: The Paris Peace Accords officially end direct U.S. involvement in the Vietnam War.
events.significance: Marked a significant step toward ending the Vietnam War and reshaping U.S. foreign policy.

events.title: Edvard Munch Unveils 'The Scream'
events.description: Norwegian artist Edvard Munch publicly exhibits his iconic painting 'The Scream' for the first time.
events.significance: The painting becomes a symbol of existential angst and one of the most famous artworks of modern art.
